item.title: Easter celebrations held in Israel as Gaza strikes continue
item.description: Easter celebrations were held in Jerusalem as Israel continued military strikes in Gaza. Holly Williams reports.

item.title: Biden rebukes Trump after social media post
item.description: President Biden criticized former President Trump after the presumptive 2024 GOP nominee shared a social media post showing Mr. Biden restrained in the back of a pickup truck. Skyler Henry reports.

item.title: 3/31: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Easter celebrations held in Israel as Gaza strikes continue; All-women mariachi band takes on male-dominated genre

item.title: Women's Elite 8 games played with mismatched 3-point lines
item.description: The 3-point lines for NCAA women's basketball tournament games in Portland were different distances at each end of the court for several games before the problem was noticed.

item.title: 3/31: The Takeout: Filmmaker Brian Knappenberger
item.description: For this edition of "The Takeout," Major Garrett speaks to filmmaker Brian Knappenberger about directing the nine-part documentary series, "Turning Point: The Bomb and the Cold War." The Netflix series offers a comprehensive look at the Cold War and its aftermath. Knappenberger says the aim of his documentary was to reflect and to also explore present-day tensions.

item.title: 3/31/2024: Targeting Americans; Indian Relay
item.description: First, new Havana Syndrome evidence is revealed. Then, a look inside the dangerous Indian Relay horse race.

item.title: "CBS Weekend News" headlines for Sunday, March 31, 2024
item.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Weekend News" with Jericka Duncan.

item.title: 5-year Havana Syndrome investigation finds new evidence of who might be responsible
item.description: 60 Minutes producers Michael Rey and Oriana Zill de Granados discuss the evolution of their 5-year investigation into Havana Syndrome, which led them to what one source calls "a receipt" for acoustic weapon testing done by a Russian intelligence unit.

item.title: Havana Syndrome in Vietnam: Possible Russian role in attack on Americans, according to new evidence
item.description: Eleven U.S. officials were injured in a Havana Syndrome-style attack ahead of VP Kamala Harris's 2021 trip to Hanoi. A newly discovered document suggests Russia may have been involved.

item.title: Havana Syndrome evidence suggests who may be responsible for mysterious brain injuries
item.description: Efforts continue to investigate brain injuries suffered by U.S. officials. This is the fourth 60 Minutes Havana Syndrome report and, for the first time, there’s evidence of who might be responsible.

item.title: Indian Relay horse race dubbed “America's original extreme sport” | 60 Minutes
item.description: Indian Relay, dubbed “America's original extreme sport,” has roots dating back centuries to horse stealing raids. Native Americans are keeping the dangerous and compelling racing tradition alive.

item.title: Steel beams from Key Bridge being cut as cleanup effort continues
item.description: Crews began cutting through steel beams as cranes prepared to lift debris from the collapsed Francis Scott Key bridge off the cargo ship that brought it down. The cleanup effort is key to reopening the port of Baltimore. Nicole Sganga has the latest.

item.title: Warm winters impacting nation's largest maple syrup farm
item.description: Warm winters are having a negative effect on the United States' largest maple syrup farm. Noel Brennan has the story.

item.title: All-women mariachi band takes on male-dominated genre
item.description: Dinorah Klingler grew up with mariachi music but never saw herself in the male-dominated genre. When the pandemic hit, however, she started an all-female mariachi band, and they're still going strong. Danya Bacchus has the story.

item.title: Highest minimum wage for fast food workers goes into effect Monday in California
item.description: The highest state minimum wage for fast food workers in the country will go into effect Monday in California. Jeff Nguyen takes a look at the possible impacts.

item.title: Church near World Trade Center restored | 60 Minutes
item.description: The new St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church sits at the edge of the World Trade Center, resurrected and alive – after it was nearly destroyed under its rubble on September 11, 2001.

item.title: Face The Nation: McCain, Gregory, Budde
item.description: Missed the second half of the show? The latest on... Easter celebration in Jerusalem, Humanitarian aid in Gaza and faith in America.

item.title: Final Four teams are now locked in. Here's who will compete.
item.description: Here are the 2024 Final Four teams still left in March Madness.

item.title: Indian Relay races connect Horse Nations tribes with "warriors of the past"
item.description: Indian Relay, an exciting and dangerous horse race, is a source of pride for members of the Native American Horse Nations tribes.

item.title: Russian role in attack on American officials?
item.description: Eleven U.S. officials were injured in a Havana Syndrome-style attack ahead of VP Kamala Harris's 2021 trip to Hanoi. A newly discovered document suggests Russia may have been involved.

item.title: The 5-year investigation into Havana Syndrome
item.description: 60 Minutes producers Michael Rey and Oriana Zill de Granados discuss the evolution of their 5-year investigation into Havana Syndrome, which led them to what one source calls "a receipt" for acoustic weapon testing done by a Russian intelligence unit.

item.title: Indian Relay horse races have historic roots for Native American tribes
item.description: Indian Relay, dubbed "America's original extreme sport," has roots dating back centuries to horse stealing raids. Native Americans are keeping the dangerous and compelling racing tradition alive.

item.title: Statements of White House, FBI, ODNI to 60 Minutes
item.description: Officials provided the following statements for 60 Minutes' report Sunday, "Targeting Americans."

item.title: Havana Syndrome investigator says bar for proof was set impossibly high
item.description: Efforts continue to investigate brain injuries suffered by U.S. officials. This is the fourth 60 Minutes Havana Syndrome report and, for the first time, there's evidence of who might be responsible.

item.title: Russian nexus revealed during five-year Havana Syndrome investigation
item.description: A lead Havana Syndrome investigator believes the U.S. is being attacked by Russia, despite a government report that deemed it "very unlikely" that a foreign adversary was behind what they call "anomalous health incidents."

item.title: Christians celebrate Easter at Church of the Holy Sepulcher in contested Jerusalem
item.description: In Jerusalem, Easter Sunday celebrations were muted at the Church of the Holy Sepulcher, believed to be the site of Jesus Christ's crucifixion. Members of Jerusalem's Christian minority say they are under attack amid the war between Israel and Hamas. Holly Williams reports.

item.title: World Food Programme's Cindy McCain says they need "full, unfettered access" into Gaza
item.description: As the humanitarian crisis in Gaza continues amid the war between Israel and Hamas, World Food Programme executive director Cindy McCain tells "Face the Nation" that the organization needs "full, unfettered access" into the region "and right now we don't have that."

item.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation," March 31, 2024
item.description: On this "Face the Nation" broadcast, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott join Ed O'Keefe.

item.title: 7 minors injured in mass shooting outside Indianapolis mall, police say
item.description: Seven minors between the ages of 12 and 17 were hospitalized with gunshot wounds Saturday night. A suspect has not been found.

item.title: Turner says there is a "chaos caucus" who want to block any Congressional action
item.description: Rep. Mike Turner tells "Face the Nation" that there is a "chaos caucus that wants to stop everything that a person in Congress does" as Speaker Mike Johnson faces a possible motion to vacate.
